recipes.win_db_mssql::do_import_sql_dump_from_s3: Downloads an sql dump from an s3 bucket and imports it into the database.
recipes.win_db_mssql::do_restore_database: Restores a database from a local machine directory.
recipes.win_db_mssql::do_backup_database: Backs up a database to a local machine directory.
recipes.win_db_mssql::do_backup_database_to_s3: Backs up a database to a local machine directory.

long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

MSSQL Recipes and Providers

= REQUIREMENTS:



= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale ServerTemplate.

Boot Scripts
  * default - default IIS site

Operational Scripts
  * backup_database - Backs up a database to a local machine directory.
  * restore_database - Restores a database from a local machine directory.
  * drop_database - Drops a database.
name: win_db_mssql
license:
Copyright (c) 2010 RightScale, Inc.

All rights reserved

s3/bucket_backups.description: The name of the S3 bucket

db_sqlserver/backup/existing_backup_file.description: Wildcard file matching pattern (i.e. not a Regex) with Powershell-style string format arguments for finding backup files. The 0 argument represents the database name and the rest of the pattern should match the file names generated from the backup_file_name_format.

db_sqlserver/backup/backup_file_name_for.description: Format string with Powershell-style string format arguments for creating backup files. The 0 argument represents the database name and the 1 argument represents a generated time stamp.

db_sqlserver/server_name.description: The network name of the SQL Server instance used by recipes.

aws/access_key_id.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve you access identifiers. Ex: 1JHQQ4KVEVM02KVEVM02

s3/file.description: Sql dump file to be retrieved from the s3 bucket

aws/secret_access_key.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve your access identifiers. Ex: XVdxPgOM4auGcMlPz61IZGotpr9LzzI07tT8s2Ws

db_sqlserver/database_name.description: SQL Server database(schema) name. Ex: production

db_sqlserver/backup/database_backup_dir.description: The local drive path or UNC path to the directory which will contain new SQL Server database backup (.bak) files. Note that network drives are not supported by SQL Server.

s3/bucket_dump.description: The name of the S3 bucket
